channel.title: CVE Feed for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiSandbox
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiSandbox

item.title: CVE-2021-24014|2024-08-03T19:14:10.114Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: Multiple instances of improper neutralization of input during web page generation vulnerabilities in FortiSandbox before 4.0.0 may allow an unauthenticated attacker to perform an XSS attack via specifically crafted request parameters.

item.title: CVE-2021-22125|2024-08-03T18:30:24.068Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: An instance of improper neutralization of special elements in the sniffer module of FortiSandbox before 3.2.2 may allow an authenticated administrator to execute commands on the underlying system's shell via altering the content of its configuration file.

item.title: CVE-2021-24010|2024-08-03T19:14:10.107Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: Improper limitation of a pathname to a restricted directory vulnerabilities in FortiSandbox 3.2.0 through 3.2.2, and 3.1.0 through 3.1.4 may allow an authenticated user to obtain unauthorized access to files and data via specifially crafted web requests.

item.title: CVE-2021-26097|2024-08-03T20:19:19.826Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: An improper neutralization of special elements used in an OS Command vulnerability in FortiSandbox 3.2.0 through 3.2.2, 3.1.0 through 3.1.4, and 3.0.0 through 3.0.6 may allow an authenticated attacker with access to the web GUI to execute unauthorized code or commands via specifically crafted HTTP requests.

item.title: CVE-2021-26096|2024-08-03T20:19:19.778Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: Multiple instances of heap-based buffer overflow in the command shell of FortiSandbox before 4.0.0 may allow an authenticated attacker to manipulate memory and alter its content by means of specifically crafted command line arguments.

item.title: CVE-2021-26098|2024-08-03T20:19:19.486Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortisandbox
item.description: An instance of small space of random values in the RPC API of FortiSandbox before 4.0.0 may allow an attacker in possession of a few information pieces about the state of the device to possibly predict valid session IDs.
